claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination effectively triggers local type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: | Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors |
- Blocking type I interferon signaling with anti-IFNAR1 eliminated the observed sensitization benefit.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination broadens the tumor immunopeptidome and MHC-I presentation.

evidence.quote: | Fraction of tumor proteins represented in immunopeptidome | 62.3% | 37.3% | Broader antigen display after intratumoral mRNA vaccination |
| Fraction of proteins represented in MHC-I peptidome | 40.6% | 20.6% | Strong expansion of MHC-I-presented landscape |

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: mRNA vaccination improves subsequent sensitivity to checkpoint blockade therapies.

evidence.quote: | Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy |
5. Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice and aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.

claims.claim: Human patients with prior mRNA vaccination have improved outcomes under ICI therapy.

evidence.quote: | Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment |
- The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.

claims.caveat: Tumor-type mix and treatment-history heterogeneity limit direct causal interpretation.
